newsitem.title: USA: Great Western to sell student loan business.
newsitem.headline: Great Western to sell student loan business.

text.p: Great Western Financial Corp said it reached an agreement to sell its studend loan business to Crestar Financial Corp based in Richmond.
It expects to realize an after-tax gain of $13.8 million from the sale in the fourth quarter of 1996.

Great Western said the sale, which is expected to close before the end of the year, involves the bank's entire student loan operation, including a portfolio of about $370 million of student loans in California and Florida. Specific terms of the sale were not disclosed.

Great Western said the sale is the latest step in a program to restructure its retail lines of business. Last month the bank said it is exploring strategic alternatives, including a sale or joint venture, for its mutal funds subsidiary, Sierra Capital Management.
